titleStmt.title: John W. Finnell, Receipt to John P. Nunnelly
CWG13725

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.idno: QMG Box 10; 1863 Office Expenses - Telegraph, Stationary - Transportation - Ordinance Stores; Bundle 5

body.p:
NO. 12.
The State of Kentucky,
To John P Nunely -- Dr.

row.cell: For use of waggon with four horses 6 days & finding himself & Team Hawling Lumber to Camp Jacobs at $4 -- pr Day for purpose of building Barracks for 43d Ky I. they being without shelter or Tents --

body.p:
Approved By order of the Governor
Jno. W Finnell adjt Genl
I certify that the above account is correct and just; that the articles services were furnished rendered as stated: and that they were a necessary for the public service. and at a reasonable price
approved T. Z. Morrow Col Comdg 43rd K V. J W. Woodcock Qr M 43d. Regt Ky Vol

Jno W Finnell
Adjt Genl ky vols
Received at Frankfort Ky, the 15 of May, 1863, of Jno W. Finnell Adj Genl, Quarter-master, Kentucky Volunteers, the sum of Twenty four -- Dollars and -- Cents, in full of the above account.

NO. 12.
No. 191 182 Abstract B P Qr. 186
John P Nunely
Dollars 24 x/100
Paid 15 May 1863
